sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities are distributing iodine pills to people living near the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, in case of a radiation leak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO Security General has called for an increase in the Alliance's presence and investment in the Arctic, as Russia reopens hundreds of military sites in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hungary gives the green light to start the construction of two new nuclear reactors by Rosatom, Russia's state nuclear agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A house and ceramics factory lay ruined in the city of Slavyansk in eastern Ukraine after a strike by Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both buildings caught on fire after the attack, but no injuries or casualties were reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A missile also struck the center of Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv. According to Ukrainian authorities, there were no casualties in the strike, but one woman was injured. One resident said after the attack, I can't understand where they're shooting at. If it's a military object, then I'm Indira Gandhi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I don't have any decent words.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I only have words that I don't want to say out loud.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Bamut, close to the front lines, the realities of the war is marked on the city's buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But despite its proximity to the fighting, some of the city's elderly population have decided to stay in their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One person justified the decision by saying, What should we do? Let's get out of here? I'm not going to leave here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I buried my parents here. My grandmother is very old. Who needs her? Who will take care of her except me? I don't want to crawl from house to house renting. Yes, I'd better stay here even in ruins but they're mine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the Donetsk region at least two civilians have been killed and another 12 have been injured, according to Ukrainian officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, concerns are mounting about the conditions of Ukraine's Zaporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities have distributed iodine pills to the people living around the plant in case of a radiation leak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both Moscow and Kiev have accused the other of carrying out strikes near the plant and endangering the structure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The UN's International Atomic Energy Agency is poised to visit the site, with some predictions saying that it could visit the site as early as next week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO Security General Jens Stoltenberg called for an increase in the alliance's security in the Arctic, as Russia is growing its military presence in the region by reopening military sites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And he warned that the shortest path for Moscow's missiles to reach North America would be through the North Pole. Russia has set up a new Arctic command.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It has opened hundreds of new and former Soviet-era Arctic military sites, including airfields and deep-water ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia is also using the region as a testbed for many of its new and novel weapon systems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Stoltenberg also noted that after Finland and Sweden joins the group, seven of the eight Arctic countries will be NATO members, excluding only Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Canada had previously been cautious about NATO's presence in the Arctic region, but its prime minister claims that the war in Ukraine has changed the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is important that we all recognize the shifting geopolitical realities that the world is now facing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And across the NATO alliance, countries are investing more in ability to secure NATO territory, including across the Arctic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Stoltenberg also expressed concerns about Beijing's growing interest in the Arctic as it plans to build the world's largest icebreaker fleet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian state-owned company Rosatom is set to begin the construction of two new nuclear reactors at the Hungarian Pax power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The expansion plan stems from a 2014 deal between the two countries, which will see the plant's nuclear capacity more than double.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The expansion project is set to be carried out with a Russian loan and will cost some 12.5 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Hungarian foreign minister celebrated the beginning of the works.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It is now clearer than ever that the countries that have nuclear energy and nuclear power plants can feel more secure in terms of their energy supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The greater the nuclear energy capacity of a country, the safer it will be in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While the EU bloc has sanctioned Russia economically for its war in Ukraine and is moving away from Russian gas and oil, current restrictions do not include the Russian nuclear industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hungary has not unconditionally supported the European decisions and aims to secure the country's future energy supplies with this expansion in light of the current energy crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No EUROPride will be held this year after host city Belgrade cancelled the event in honour of the LGBTQ community less than a month before it was due to start.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: EUROPride 2022 was set to be held between September 12 to 18 with parades, vigils and other events open to the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Since the 90s, almost every European capital has hosted the Pan-European Pride event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At a press conference, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said the Pride Parade, or whatever you want to call this thing scheduled for September, will be postponed or cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He explained that the country couldn't host the annual festivities due to an ongoing crisis with neighboring Kosovo, various economic problems and threats made by right-wing extremists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: During the conference, he added, he also proposed extending the term of Serbia's prime minister, who identifies as a lesbian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Europride organizers were outraged by the cancellation, citing a violation of the constitution and promised that the big parade would go on ahead on the 17th of September at 5pm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They pointed out that the right to organize a pride has been ruled by the European Court of Human Rights to be a fundamental human right and that it was up to the authorities to ensure security from those who sought to discredit the march.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Despite the fact that Serbia is one of the few countries to have an openly gay prime minister, previous pride events have been marred by the presence of anti-gay protesters, violent clashes and needed massive police intervention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France has dealt with a summer of heat waves, fires and now arsonists, as it has charged two of its volunteer firefighters with setting some of the blazes that have been devastating the southern parts of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One of the firefighters is a 27-year-old who allegedly started a fire that burned through 230 hectares of land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some of his colleagues came to his hearing on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: One firefighter said that his action sullies the uniform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He is out of the question to show any tolerance on this subject.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A 35-year-old man is also in jail for allegedly starting several other fires, but he denies the charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Before these two men, another volunteer firefighter admitted to starting fires over a period of several years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And he said he was motivated by a need for social recognition and the adrenaline rush. According to an officer, authorities suspect a he was motivated by a need for social recognition and the adrenaline rush. According to an officer, authorities suspect a fire was started by arsonists when multiple fires start simultaneously. These men are not alone. Since the start of the summer, authorities have arrested 34 arsonists, according to France's interior ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis has appointed 20 more cardinals to the Catholic Church,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 16 of whom are under the age of 80, allowing them to participate in the conclave upon the Pope's death or resignation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Only cardinals under that age limit are allowed to cast ballots for a new Pope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over half of the cardinals currently eligible to vote have been appointed by the current Pope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: currently eligible to vote, have been appointed by the current Pope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over 3,500 people marched in the anti-racism protest in northeastern Germany, 30 years after a racist mob attacked the city's reception centers for asylum seekers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The march was meant to both remember and oppose the Rostock riots when extremists attacked the housing complex where Vietnamese workers were living some 150 people were put in mortal danger because of the attack it's an ecological nightmare the tourist marina of giga Titsa on the Oda River in Poland is empty only the fire brigade remains to continue removing the dead fish from the polluted waters. On a good weekend, Dziga Cice used to attract between 5,000 and 10,000 tourists. Now, 300 tons of dead fish to be fished out, a pungent smell and a collapsing economy are all that remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: People are afraid of the river. It's hard to predict if this water poisoning will stay on their minds for a long time or if they will forget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But for us, it's 12 years of work down the drain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For environmental experts, industrial pollution is to blame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The disaster may have been triggered by toxic algae caused by industrial waste in Poland knowing the approach of the Polish government towards ecology nature and environment one could expect this the truth is that the order was a time bomb because we all knew that many factories in Silesia were discharging the wastewater directly into it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The river was heavily polluted until the late 1990s, an industrial legacy from the communist era.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In 1997, following a massive flood, the river cleaned itself up and the tourists returned.
